title: Humza Yousaf’s SNP cabinet reshuffle ‘is hand-to-mouth politics’
description: Party insiders are critical of first minister’s promotions after Michael Matheson’s resignation over iPad affair: why didn’t he bring back Kate Forbes?

title: Labour MPs facing wave of independent challengers over stance on Gaza
description: Starmer initially refused to back a ceasefire last year, with Labour MPs told not to vote in favour of the SNP motion backing one. He also faced criticism for an interview in which he appeared to support Israel’s right to cut off power and water in Gaza.

title: More than 12,000 died before reaching hospital by ambulance last year
description: Party leader Anas Sarwar said the statistic, obtained using freedom of information legislation, shows the 'real-world consequences' of 'SNP incompetence'.

title: Fergus Ewing 'delighted' Fiona Hyslop is appointed transport secretary overseeing the A9
description: The Inverness and Nairn MSP says of Humza Yousaf's pick that 'no one has put more effort into A9 dualling than Fiona'

title: Civil War: The battle brewing in Scottish politics over Covid Inquiry revelations
description: For the Tories, there has been “unacceptable” shift away from the civil service’s traditional, and protected, impartiality. For Labour, as reported in the Sunday Herald, the civil service has been “captured wholesale and the lines between political interest and public service have not just become blurred, they have disappeared”.

title: Disabled access issues at Ayrshire train stations branded a 'scandal'

title: Sunak promises to deliver tax cuts in ‘long term’ amid Spring Budget speculation
description: Rishi Sunak has promised to deliver tax cuts in the “long-term” amid growing speculation about the content of next month’s Spring Budget. In an interview with The Times, the Prime Minister said that the “trajectory” of his government was to cut taxes but would not specify how or when.

title: There comes a time when asking nicely isn’t enough

title: Tax haven upon Tweed: Special report by Jonathan Brocklebank
description: Estate agents say the street is one of the prime targets of largely Edinburgh-based high earners looking to avoid the SNP’s increasingly punitive tax regime. It is the pick of a bunch of affluent locations in north Northumberland now catching the eye of ...

title: SNP ignored financial warnings - and sparked the great tartan tax exodus!
description: Scots are fleeing across the Border in droves to escape the SNP 's tax hikes. The mass exodus of high earners is sparking a property boom in northern England as workers try to protect their pay.

title: Tory MSP stands down from Holyrood to take up position at Scotland Office

title: Thousands of McClure clients 'still unaware' historic solicitors firm went bust
description: SNP MSP Stuart McMillan has now lodged a motion in the Scottish Parliament on the issue and won cross-party support. It calls on Holyrood to recognise that "a substantial portion of the firm's former clients remain unaware of its closure and the transfer ...

title: General election poll tracker
description: The Telegraph’s poll tracker shows that Labour continues to have a dominating lead over the Tories, who were last ahead in late 2021. On Thursday, the Conservative Party will face by-elections in both Kingswood and Wellingborough, which had both been Tory seats.

title: Student killed in turbulent protests over Senegal's election delay
description: A student died during protests in the Senegalese city of Saint-Louis, the interior ministry said on Saturday, becoming the first person killed in unrest that broke out after a presidential election planned for this month was pushed back to the end of the year.

title: Michael Matheson ‘could be forced out as MSP’ over iPad scandal

title: Preview: Leafs in Ottawa
